dual_stat_focus.effect: After hitting an enemy, your Endurance Defense against that target cannot be lowered for the remainder of the round.
When successfully hitting an enemy with a Melee Attack, you restore 1 point of Presence Resource.
When performing a Slight of Hand check, you may use your Might score instead of Finesse to overwhelm perception.
On a Critical Hit, the enemy must drop their weapon unless they pass a Finesse Check (DC 15).
You may use a Minor Action to restore 1 Chi.
Once per round, when you restore Chi, you may restore 1 point of Presence Resource.
When your HP drops below 25%, you automatically restore 1 point of Presence Resource.
When you successfully Grapple a target, the target suffers a Minor Injury.
When suffering Composure Damage, you may spend 1 Presence to reduce the damage taken by 1 (minimum 1).
On a successful Melee Attack, the target suffers -2m movement penalty until the start of your next turn.
When making a Debate check against a physically larger opponent, use your Might score instead of Knowledge.
Once per scene, you may spend a resource point from Presence and count it as a point for Guile.
You may use a Minor Action to gain +2 on your next Defense roll against a Melee Attack.
When attacking a target that is Staggered, your attack ignores 1 point of Damage Reduction.
When you successfully Insight a target, your next attack against them is made with Advantage.
You may spend 1 Tactics to include an additional 1d4 damage on a successful Intimidation check.
Once per scene, when your Composure drops to zero, you may spend 1 Instinct to convert the Rage to Fear.
When using Unarmed or Swinging Weapons, you deal 1d4 bonus damage against targets that are Prone or Staggered.
When you deal a Solid Hit, force target to pass a Willpower check or suffer Minor Composure Damage.
When an ally successfully attacks a target you have recently Intimidated, they restore 1 point to their Presence Resource.
Spend a point from Presence and count it as a resource point for Instinct for a single action.
Your Melee Attacks automatically overcome Damage Reduction if the target is Staggered.
Spend Tactics to force a visible enemy to pass an Endurance Check or lose 1 point of Stamina.
Gain Advantage on Defense Checks against Ambushes and automatically act first in a surprise round.
Spend 1 Stamina and 1 Chi to become immune to the next Major Injury (once per scene).
When successfully Negotiating, spend Instinct to force the opposing party to accept 3 additional penalties.
